page.title: 14Industry in Trafford Park 1
page.content: The area is completely dominated by industry. There used to be a small area of housing at 796 964, with schools and churches. The roads were called 'First Avenue', 'Second Avenue' etc. up to 'Twelfth Avenue' and formed a compact unit like a village. This is now a redevelopment area and industry with car parking will be built on it. There are still a few cafes, banks, newsagents and betting shops at 795 963 and 795 966 and they serve the needs of the workers who now travel in from outside. Some industry, such as timber importing, bonded warehousing for tobacco, rubber products and chemicals began here because they used the canal to import the raw materials but the canal is now virtually closed at the Manchester end.
